subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Monday, 07 May, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Ferguson has three summer targets
Man Utd boss Sir Alex Ferguson wants the Premiership champions to make three new signings in the close season.



 
Allardyce tipped for Magpies job
Ex-Bolton boss Sam Allardyce is the favourite to take over as Newcastle manager after the resignation of Glenn Roeder.



 
Shevchenko to miss FA Cup final
Chelsea striker Andriy Shevchenko will undergo groin surgery on Tuesday, meaning he will miss the FA Cup final.








GOLF




Woods battles to Wachovia victory
Tiger Woods shoots a final-round 69 to clinch the Wachovia Championship in Charlotte by two strokes.



 
Fernandez-Castano wins play-off
Spain's Gonzalo Fernandez-Castano beats Austrian Markus Brier in a play-off to win the Italian Open.



 
Kim overcomes Inkster in play-off
South Korea's Mi Hyun Kim beats American Juli Inkster in a play-off for the SemGroup Championship.








MOTORSPORT




Stoner powers to Shanghai victory
Ducati's Casey Stoner saw off the challenge of Valentino Rossi to win the China Grand Prix and extend his MotoGP series lead to 15 points.



 
Loeb wraps up Argentina victory
World champion Sebastien Loeb wins the Rally of Argentina.



 
Rossi clinches pole in Shanghai
Five-time world champion Valentino Rossi claimed pole position for the China Grand Prix in Shanghai.








FORMULA ONE




Alonso backs Spanish GP changes
World champion Fernando Alonso says changes to Spain's Grand Prix track will make overtaking easier.



 
Second crash at Spanish GP track
Williams' Nico Rosberg is unhurt in the second high-speed crash at the Circuit de Catalunya this week.



 
F1 races still boring - Briatore
Renault team boss Flavio Briatore says changes aimed at livening up Formula One have not worked.








ATHLETICS




Kenyan triumphs in Edinburgh run
Hosea Macharinyang wins the men's Great Edinburgh Run, with Jelena Prokopcuka securing the women's title.



 
Ennis equals GB high jump record
Jessica Ennis starts the outdoor season in superb style at an international combined events meetings in Italy.



 
Back injury frustrates Radcliffe
Paula Radcliffe is unlikely to defend her World Athletics Championships marathon title because of a back problem.








CYCLING




Basso admits scandal involvement
Italy's Ivan Basso admits that he was involved in the Operation Puerto blood doping scandal but gives no further details.



 
GB is top cycling nation - King
British Cycling boss Peter King says this country's riders are the best in the world and will be GB's best hopes of Olympic gold.



 
Under-fire Basso parts with team
Ivan Basso quits the Discovery Channel team after an investigation into his role in a Spanish doping scandal is reopened.








FUN AND GAMES




Holloway column
"I'm not a fan of the Kate Moss range - shorts and leggings, what's that about?"



 
Review of the week
